title: Religion: Events for Oct. 9, 2015
text: Religion: Events for Oct. 9, 2015 Religion: Events for Oct. 9, 2015 By Union Democrat staff October 09, 2015 01:00 am St. Patrick’s Catholic Church will host a Public Square Rosary Crusade at noon Saturday in Courthouse Square in downtown Sonora. All are invited to join in praying publicly for our nation. For more information, call 532-7139. Sierra Bible Church will host an event called “Seasons” from 10 a.m. to noon Thursday at 15171 Tuolumne Road, Sonora. The event is for women of all generations to gather and create a sisterhood that will encourage and support each other through the seasons of life, stated a press release. The group will meet the third Thursday of each month starting Oct. 15 in the Worship Center. Childcare cost is $5 and is available by calling 743-1913. St. Susanna Orthodox Church’s weekly Catechism class is postponed until Oct. 20. Classes are generally held at 6 p.m. each Tuesday. The classes offer study of the Catechism series, written by the renowned Orthodox educator Father Thomas Hopko, and the New King James translation of the Bible. For more information, call 352-6791. St. Susanna Orthodox Church is at 10825 Robinwood Lane, at the intersection of Jamestown Road, in Sonora. In recognition of the dedicated work of Catholic health care professionals, St. Patrick’s Catholic Church will celebrate a “White Mass” from 9 to 11 a.m. on Oct. 18 at 127 Jackson St., Sonora. The Mass is a special celebration to acknowledge the unique contributions made by all Catholic health care professionals and takes its name from the white coat most commonly worn by those in the medical field. All Catholic physicians, nurses, physicians’ assistants, pharmacists, emergency personnel and anyone who works in health care and their families are invited to attend. For more information, call 532-7139. Evangelist Brian Besser will be guest speaker Oct. 24 at a Real Men Breakfast at the Word of Life Fellowship Church on Highway 108 in Mi-Wuk Village. The event, 8:30 to 10:30 a.m., is a faith-based, nonprofit community event for men ages 16 and older. Breakfast admission is $5 per person, and tickets can be purchased at Greg’s Barbershop in East Sonora, Word of Life Fellowship Church, Harvest Fellowship or The Country Cowboy Church. For more information, call 533-0406. The Mother Lode Jewish Community will hold a special Brush and Cork session, in which participants will have a “grown-up paint by numbers” art class focusing on Chanukah, on Nov. 15. Cost is $38, and the deadline to register is Oct. 26. The event will also be a potluck To register or for more information on either event, go online to motherlodejewishcommunity.org or call 533-1650.
